skill.name: cosmic-database
skill.description: Access COSMIC cancer mutation database. Query somatic mutations, Cancer Gene Census, mutational signatures, gene fusions, for cancer research and precision oncology. Requires authentication.
skill.summary: Access COSMIC cancer mutation database. Query somatic mutations, Cancer Gene Census, mutational sign...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill performs authenticated network requests to the COSMIC download service and writes files locally. It does not execute downloaded content or attempt persistence. Risk is limited to network usage and local file writes.

content.value_statement: You need authenticated access to COSMIC cancer mutation files. This skill downloads COSMIC datasets and provides common file paths for fast setup.
actual_capabilities: Authenticate with COSMIC email and password to request download URLs
Download COSMIC files with streaming and progress output
Resolve common COSMIC file paths by data type and genome assembly
Provide a CLI for data type, assembly, version, and output filename
Return success or failure status for downloads
limitations: Requires a registered COSMIC account and valid credentials
Needs internet access to the COSMIC download service
Shortcut data types are limited to the predefined list
Does not analyze or filter downloaded data

use_cases.title: Pull mutation exports
use_cases.description: Download COSMIC mutation files for a specific release and genome assembly.

use_cases.title: Automate dataset sync
use_cases.description: Script repeatable COSMIC downloads for pipelines and audits.

use_cases.title: Fetch gene census
use_cases.description: Retrieve Cancer Gene Census files for gene prioritization work.

prompt_templates.title: First download
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the latest COSMIC coding mutations file for GRCh38 and save it as cosmic_mutations.tsv.gz.

prompt_templates.title: Gene census
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the Cancer Gene Census file for GRCh38 and name it cancer_gene_census.csv.

prompt_templates.title: Versioned release
prompt_templates.prompt: Download COSMIC version v102 structural variants for GRCh37 and save it as cosmic_structural.tsv.gz.

prompt_templates.title: Custom path
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the COSMIC file at GRCh38/cosmic/latest/CosmicResistanceMutations.tsv.gz and save it as resistance.tsv.gz.

output_examples.input: Download the latest Cancer Gene Census for GRCh38.
output: Requested the COSMIC download URL for the gene census file
Saved as cancer_gene_census.csv in the current folder

best_practices: Use latest for ongoing work and a fixed version for reproducibility
Check disk space before large downloads
Store credentials securely and avoid sharing them in logs
anti_patterns: Using the skill without a valid COSMIC account
Requesting analysis or filtering within the downloader
Assuming files exist without checking version and assembly

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides a Python script and CLI that work in those environments.

faq.question: What limits apply to downloads?
faq.answer: Limits depend on COSMIC access rights and the size of the requested files.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, the CLI and helper functions are designed for scripted workflows.

faq.question: Does it store or transmit my credentials?
faq.answer: Credentials are used only for COSMIC authentication and are not stored by the script.

faq.question: What should I do if authentication fails?
faq.answer: Verify your COSMIC registration, license status, email, and password.

faq.question: How does this compare to web downloads?
faq.answer: It enables automated, repeatable downloads with reusable file path helpers.
